message.raw:
Allow instantiating a Run() from within a function.
Previously a Run could not save results if it was instantiated from within a
function, as within the function there is no local variable called `__file__`,
which is what is used to determine the results group to save results to.
All Run objects had to be created in the global scope.

Now we look at the global variables a frame sees instead of the local variables.
So `__file__` is visible and the group used will be whichever one the function
was defined in (likely the `__main__` module but up to you!)
